title: N'Golo Kante suffers fresh injury blow in France warm-up ahead of Iceland clash
text:

Chelsea midfielder N'Golo Kante has handed Frank Lampard a fresh injury worry by limping off with muscle problem in the warm-up ahead of France's Euro 2020 qualifier with Iceland on Friday night.

Kante has suffered with fitness issues throughout the campaign thus far, and has only featured in four of the Blues' eight Premier League fixtures - scoring in the 2-1 loss to Liverpool last month and the 4-1 victory over Southampton last weekend.

Lampard had been in dialogue with France boss Didier Deschamps over the selection of Kante for the world champions' squad, which led to the former Leicester midfielder missing France's matches against Albania and Andorra in September's international break.

Deschamps - himself a former Chelsea player - spoke about his conversations with Lampard when he announced his squad earlier this month, and took a little dig at the former England midfielder over his team selection .

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

"Lampard had asked me not to pick Kante at the last break," he told a press conference.

"If that's still the way I'm going to call him later to tell him it would be nice if you play Olivier Giroud a little bit!"

Kante was replaced by Tottenham midfielder Moussa Sissoko for the qualifier in Reykjavik.

Speaking after last month's win over Brighton , Lampard addressed Kante's injuries this season.

(Image: Getty Images)

"My feeling is that he has played a lot and that's because he has been so successful and so important to the teams he has been in," he said.

"At the minute, he has injuries.

"This little niggle he had is a small, small injury. We just need to get it right. We are just careful and it is my duty to work with him. The medical team are working so hard with him."
description: The Chelsea midfielder has suffered from numerous fitness issues already this season
